text.0: his honouring rite whose grass is trimmed is offered swiftly to you in manus wise accordant.
text.1: the rite which indravaruṇa shall carry this day to high success and glorious issue.
text.2: for at gods worship they are best through vigour they have become the strongest of the heroes.
text.3: with mighty strength most liberal of the princes chiefs of the host by law made vṛtras slayers.
text.4: praise those twain gods for powers that merit worship indra and varuṇa for bliss the joyous.
text.5: one with his might and thunderbolt slays vṛtra the other as a sage stands near in troubles.
text.6: though dames and men have waxen strong and mighty and all the gods selfpraised among the heroes.
text.7: ye indravaruṇa have in might surpassed them and thus were ye spread wide o earth and heaven.
text.8: righteous is he and liberal and helpful who indravaruṇa brings you gifts with gladness.
text.9: that bounteous man through food shall conquer faemen and win him opulence and wealthy people.
text.10: may wealth which ye bestow in food and treasure on him who brings you gifts and sacrifices.
text.11: wealth gods which breaks the curse of those who vex us be indravaruṇa een our own possession.
text.12: so also indravaruṇa may our princes have riches swift to save with gods to guard them.
text.13: they whose great might gives victory in battles and their triumphant glory spreads with swiftness.
text.14: indra and varuṇa gods whom we are lauding mingle ye wealth with our heroic glory.
text.15: may we who praise the strength of what is mighty pass dangers as with boats we cross the waters.
text.16: now will i sing a dear and farextending hymn to varuṇa the god sublime imperial lord.
text.17: who mighty governor eternal as with flame illumines both wide worlds with majesty and power.
text.18: true to law indravaruṇa drinkers of the juice drink this pressed soma which shall give you rapturous joy.
text.19: your chariot cometh to the banquet of the gods to sacrifice as it were home that ye may drink.
text.20: indra and varuṇa drink your fill ye heroes of this invigorating sweetest soma.
text.21: this juice is shed by us that ye may quaff it on this trimmed grass be seated and rejoice you.
